response: "{ \"title\": \"Harmonious Melodies\", \"description\": \"A harmonious melody is a sequence of notes that sounds pleasant when played. A note is considered harmonious if it belongs to one of the three main scales: major, minor, or diminished. Write a function `is_harmonious` that checks if a given list of notes is harmonious.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_harmonious(notes: list) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `notes` (list): A list of notes, each note being a string representing the name of the note (e.g., 'A', 'Bb', 'C#'). The list may contain duplicates.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if all notes in the input list are harmonious, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"\\nimport music21\\n\\ndef is_harmonious(notes: list) -> bool:\\n    # Define the three main scales\\n    major_scale = ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']\\n    minor_scale = ['C', 'Dbb', 'Eb', 'Fb', 'Gb', 'Ab', 'Bbb']\\n    diminished_scale = ['Co', 'Do', 'Eo', 'Fo', 'Go', 'Ao', 'Bo']\\n\\n    # Check each note against the three scales\\n    for note in notes:\\n        if note not in major_scale + minor_scale + diminished_scale:\\n            return False\\n\\n    return True\\n\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_harmonious(['C', 'D', 'E']) == True\", \"assert is_harmonious(['G', 'F#', 'A']) == True\", \"assert is_harmonious(['hello', 'world']) == False\", \"assert is_harmonious(['Bb', 'Db', 'Eb']) == True\"] }"
